title: China Eximbank provides RMB 1.145 billion government concessional loan for Addis Ababa Power Network Rehabilitation and Upgrading Project
description: On July 28, 2016, China Eximbank and the Government of Ethiopia signed an RMB 1,145,000,000 (ETB 4,759,718,710) government concessional loan (GCL) agreement [CHINA EXIMBANK GCL No. (2016) 18 TOTAL NO. (588) 1420303052016111722] for the Addis Ababa Power Network Rehabilitation and Upgrading Project. The Ethiopian House of Representatives ratified the agreement under Proclamation No. 987/2016 on December 27, 2016. The borrowing terms of the GCL are as follows: a 2% interest rate, a 20 year maturity, a 7 year grace period, a 0.25% management fee, and a 0.25% commitment fee.   The borrower was expected to use the proceeds of the GCL to finance a commercial (EPC) contract between Ethiopian Electric Power Corporation (EEPCo), Ethiopia Electric Utility (EEU), and a consortium (joint venture) consisting of Sinohydro 1st Bureau, Sinohydro 4th Bureau, and PowerChina Hubei Bureau, which was signed in April 2016.   China Eximbank made an initial loan disbursement worth RMB 326,789,264.68 (as part of an advance payment) on December 24, 2019. The World Bank also issued a $62 million loan in support of this project.   The purpose of the project is to rehabilitate and upgrade the power grid — by, among other things, replacing 45kV transmission lines with transmission 132kV lines — in Addis Ababa, Jimma, Dire Dawa, Bahir Dar, Mekele, Hawassa, Adama and Dessie.   Sinohydro 1st Bureau, Sinohydro 4th Bureau, and PowerChina Hubei Bureau are the EPC contractors responsible for project implementation. The implementation of the project commenced on February 29, 2016 and it was originally expected to reach completion within 12 months (February 28, 2017).   However, this project has encountered major implementation problems and delays. There are also indications that the China Eximbank loan for the Addis Ababa Power Network Rehabilitation and Upgrading Project has financially underperformed vis-a-vis the original expectations of the lender. According to the Government of Ethiopia’s Aid Management Platform, as of September 2019, ICBC suspended about $67 million worth of loan disbursements 'due to [the] cross-default situation of the country’ (see Project ID#58616). Then, in August 2021, China Eximbank withheld $339 million loan disbursements for 12 projects (including the Addis Ababa Power Network Rehabilitation and Upgrading Project) and halted project implementation due to Government of Ethiopia’s rapidly dwindling foreign exchange reserves and debt sustainability challenges. Demisu Lemma, the Director of Chinese Cooperation at the Ethiopian Ministry of Finance, noted at the time that the Ethiopian Government was in discussions with China Eximbank about a potential debt rescheduling (that would involved a 5-year maturity extension and a 1-year grace period extension). Then, after considerable delay, the G20 Common Framework (CF) creditor committee for Ethiopia convened in September 2021, with the French Government and the Chinese Government serving as co-chairs. The CF debt rescheduling talks were still ongoing in mid-2023.
staff_comments: 1. This project is also known as the 8 Major Cities Distribution Rehabilitation and Upgrading Project and the Addis Abeba Power Network Rehabilitation & Upgrading Project. The Chinese project title is 公司总承包建设的埃塞俄比亚中低压配网升级改造项.2. The system identification number for the project in the Government of Ethiopia’s Aid Management Platform (AMP) is 87143359111146. 3. As of December 24, 2019, the China Eximbank had achieved a 28.5% disbursement rate. The AMP reference to an ETB 48,057,245 loan disbursement on December 24, 2019 appears to be a typographical error (since it represents only 1% of the face value of the loan).
combined_text:
# Sector
ENERGY

# Title
China Eximbank provides RMB 1.145 billion government concessional loan for Addis Ababa Power Network Rehabilitation and Upgrading Project

# Description
On July 28, 2016, China Eximbank and the Government of Ethiopia signed an RMB 1,145,000,000 (ETB 4,759,718,710) government concessional loan (GCL) agreement [CHINA EXIMBANK GCL No. (2016) 18 TOTAL NO. (588) 1420303052016111722] for the Addis Ababa Power Network Rehabilitation and Upgrading Project. The Ethiopian House of Representatives ratified the agreement under Proclamation No. 987/2016 on December 27, 2016. The borrowing terms of the GCL are as follows: a 2% interest rate, a 20 year maturity, a 7 year grace period, a 0.25% management fee, and a 0.25% commitment fee.   The borrower was expected to use the proceeds of the GCL to finance a commercial (EPC) contract between Ethiopian Electric Power Corporation (EEPCo), Ethiopia Electric Utility (EEU), and a consortium (joint venture) consisting of Sinohydro 1st Bureau, Sinohydro 4th Bureau, and PowerChina Hubei Bureau, which was signed in April 2016.   China Eximbank made an initial loan disbursement worth RMB 326,789,264.68 (as part of an advance payment) on December 24, 2019. The World Bank also issued a $62 million loan in support of this project.   The purpose of the project is to rehabilitate and upgrade the power grid — by, among other things, replacing 45kV transmission lines with transmission 132kV lines — in Addis Ababa, Jimma, Dire Dawa, Bahir Dar, Mekele, Hawassa, Adama and Dessie.   Sinohydro 1st Bureau, Sinohydro 4th Bureau, and PowerChina Hubei Bureau are the EPC contractors responsible for project implementation. The implementation of the project commenced on February 29, 2016 and it was originally expected to reach completion within 12 months (February 28, 2017).   However, this project has encountered major implementation problems and delays. There are also indications that the China Eximbank loan for the Addis Ababa Power Network Rehabilitation and Upgrading Project has financially underperformed vis-a-vis the original expectations of the lender. According to the Government of Ethiopia’s Aid Management Platform, as of September 2019, ICBC suspended about $67 million worth of loan disbursements 'due to [the] cross-default situation of the country’ (see Project ID#58616). Then, in August 2021, China Eximbank withheld $339 million loan disbursements for 12 projects (including the Addis Ababa Power Network Rehabilitation and Upgrading Project) and halted project implementation due to Government of Ethiopia’s rapidly dwindling foreign exchange reserves and debt sustainability challenges. Demisu Lemma, the Director of Chinese Cooperation at the Ethiopian Ministry of Finance, noted at the time that the Ethiopian Government was in discussions with China Eximbank about a potential debt rescheduling (that would involved a 5-year maturity extension and a 1-year grace period extension). Then, after considerable delay, the G20 Common Framework (CF) creditor committee for Ethiopia convened in September 2021, with the French Government and the Chinese Government serving as co-chairs. The CF debt rescheduling talks were still ongoing in mid-2023.
justification: Project focuses on upgrading and rehabilitating power grid infrastructure, which supports energy transmission but does not directly contribute to renewable energy generation
evidence: Rehabilitation and upgrading of power grid, replacement of 45kV transmission lines with 132kV lines, multiple city coverage

title: Chinese government provides $7.6 million in wheat to Ethiopia
description: According to the Chinese embassy in Ethiopia, the Chinese government provided 10,535 tons of wheat to Ethiopia in 2016. The aid was valued at approximately 7.6 million USD. The aid was given as emergency response to food insecurity due to drought since September 2015.
combined_text:
# Sector
EMERGENCY RESPONSE

# Title
Chinese government provides $7.6 million in wheat to Ethiopia

# Description
According to the Chinese embassy in Ethiopia, the Chinese government provided 10,535 tons of wheat to Ethiopia in 2016. The aid was valued at approximately 7.6 million USD. The aid was given as emergency response to food insecurity due to drought since September 2015.
justification: Project is humanitarian aid for food security with no direct environmental or energy transition impact
evidence: Emergency food aid of 10,535 tons of wheat to address drought-related food insecurity

title: Chinese government awards 26 scholarships to Ethiopian students
description: On August 3, 2016, the Chinese government awarded 26 Ethiopian students the 2016/17 Chinese Government Scholarship to pursue their higher-level studies of masters and PhD programs at different universities in China. Present at the ceremony were La Yifan, Chinese Ambassador to Ethiopia, and Zerihun Kebede, Representative of the Ethiopian Ministry of Education.
combined_text:
# Sector
EDUCATION

# Title
Chinese government awards 26 scholarships to Ethiopian students

# Description
On August 3, 2016, the Chinese government awarded 26 Ethiopian students the 2016/17 Chinese Government Scholarship to pursue their higher-level studies of masters and PhD programs at different universities in China. Present at the ceremony were La Yifan, Chinese Ambassador to Ethiopia, and Zerihun Kebede, Representative of the Ethiopian Ministry of Education.
justification: Scholarship program focused on education without direct environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Higher education scholarships for Ethiopian students, no energy or infrastructure components mentioned

title: China builds 3 new medical centers at Tirunesh-Beijing Hospital
description: In December 2016, the Chinese and Ethiopian governments signed a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) for constructing a trauma center and nursing unit at Tirunesh-Beijing Hospital. The completion of the additions to the hospital were inaugurated on August 1, 2017, though it is unclear when construction on them began. Altogether, the China Trauma Center, the China Maternal and Child Health Center and the China Telepathology Consultation Center were added on to Tirunesh-Beijing Hospital. It is unclear how much the construction of these new buildings cost, though they were financed by the Chinese government.
combined_text:
# Sector
HEALTH

# Title
China builds 3 new medical centers at Tirunesh-Beijing Hospital

# Description
In December 2016, the Chinese and Ethiopian governments signed a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) for constructing a trauma center and nursing unit at Tirunesh-Beijing Hospital. The completion of the additions to the hospital were inaugurated on August 1, 2017, though it is unclear when construction on them began. Altogether, the China Trauma Center, the China Maternal and Child Health Center and the China Telepathology Consultation Center were added on to Tirunesh-Beijing Hospital. It is unclear how much the construction of these new buildings cost, though they were financed by the Chinese government.
justification: Project focuses on healthcare infrastructure without clear environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Construction of medical centers including trauma center, maternal and child health center, and telepathology consultation center

title: China sends medical team to Ethiopia (19th)
description: In September 2016, the Chinese government sent their 19th medical team to Ethiopia. The 19th team was a continuation of medical cooperation between Ethiopia and China since 1974. Comprising 16 medical professionals, the 19th team was headed by Zhang Xiaoyang. Members of the medical team were from China's Henan province. The team was based at the Tirunesh-Beijing Ethio-China Friendship Hospital on the outskirts of Addis Ababa. The medical team was scheduled to stay in Ethiopia for 385 days, providing free consultation and operations at Tirunesh-Beijing and other hospitals.
combined_text:
# Sector
HEALTH

# Title
China sends medical team to Ethiopia (19th)

# Description
In September 2016, the Chinese government sent their 19th medical team to Ethiopia. The 19th team was a continuation of medical cooperation between Ethiopia and China since 1974. Comprising 16 medical professionals, the 19th team was headed by Zhang Xiaoyang. Members of the medical team were from China's Henan province. The team was based at the Tirunesh-Beijing Ethio-China Friendship Hospital on the outskirts of Addis Ababa. The medical team was scheduled to stay in Ethiopia for 385 days, providing free consultation and operations at Tirunesh-Beijing and other hospitals.
justification: Project is focused on healthcare services with no direct environmental or energy transition impact
evidence: Medical team providing healthcare services, no energy or infrastructure components

title: Chinese military deploys military medical team to Ethiopia (2nd)
description: On January 9, 2016, a Chinese military medical expert team was sent to Addis Ababa, Ethiopia, to complete a one-year medical assistance mission. This is the 2nd Chinese military medical team deployed to Ethiopia. The team consisted of nine members from nine departments of the Xinqiao Hospital, one of the three teaching hospitals affiliated to the Third Military Medical University. During their year-long mission, the Chinese medical team completed more than 1,400 cases of clinic treatment and more than 150 highly difficult surgeries. The team also held lectures regularly for Ethiopian military medical personnel and provided medical imaging examinations and health care services for Ethiopian military and government officials. The medical team returned to China on January 17, 2017.
combined_text:
# Sector
HEALTH

# Title
Chinese military deploys military medical team to Ethiopia (2nd)

# Description
On January 9, 2016, a Chinese military medical expert team was sent to Addis Ababa, Ethiopia, to complete a one-year medical assistance mission. This is the 2nd Chinese military medical team deployed to Ethiopia. The team consisted of nine members from nine departments of the Xinqiao Hospital, one of the three teaching hospitals affiliated to the Third Military Medical University. During their year-long mission, the Chinese medical team completed more than 1,400 cases of clinic treatment and more than 150 highly difficult surgeries. The team also held lectures regularly for Ethiopian military medical personnel and provided medical imaging examinations and health care services for Ethiopian military and government officials. The medical team returned to China on January 17, 2017.
justification: Project is focused on healthcare services and medical training without direct environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Medical assistance mission, clinic treatment, surgeries, medical training, healthcare services

title: China sends agricultural experts to Ethiopia (17th)
description: In November 2016, the Chinese government sent the 17th team of agricultural experts to Ethiopia to provide agricultural technology vocational education and training. The experts are part of a 2001 agreement between the Ministry of Agriculture of the People's Republic of China and the Ministry of Agriculture of the Federal Democratic Republic of Ethiopia to reform Ethiopia's agricultural technical and vocational training, with China providing instructors for practical training (project #33865). According to the Economic and Commercial Counsellor's Office of the Embassy of the People's Republic of China in Ethiopia, a total of about 500 agricultural technicians, 1,800 local teachers and 35,000 students had received crop cultivation, animal health care, etc. under the guidance of Chinese experts by 2017. As of April 2017, 20 Chinese agricultural experts were providing training in Ethiopia. The 17th team was scheduled to spend a year teaching in Ethiopia.
combined_text:
# Sector
AGRICULTURE, FORESTRY, FISHING

# Title
China sends agricultural experts to Ethiopia (17th)

# Description
In November 2016, the Chinese government sent the 17th team of agricultural experts to Ethiopia to provide agricultural technology vocational education and training. The experts are part of a 2001 agreement between the Ministry of Agriculture of the People's Republic of China and the Ministry of Agriculture of the Federal Democratic Republic of Ethiopia to reform Ethiopia's agricultural technical and vocational training, with China providing instructors for practical training (project #33865). According to the Economic and Commercial Counsellor's Office of the Embassy of the People's Republic of China in Ethiopia, a total of about 500 agricultural technicians, 1,800 local teachers and 35,000 students had received crop cultivation, animal health care, etc. under the guidance of Chinese experts by 2017. As of April 2017, 20 Chinese agricultural experts were providing training in Ethiopia. The 17th team was scheduled to spend a year teaching in Ethiopia.
justification: Project focuses on agricultural education and training without clear environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Agricultural technology vocational education and training, crop cultivation and animal health care training

title: Chinese Embassy funds construction of community football court to Ethiopia
description: On April 8, 2016, the Chinese Embassy in Ethiopia officially held the opening ceremony of the community football court in the fourth street of the Kefa District of Addis Ababa. According to the Chinese Embassy in Ethiopia, the embassy and a Chinese company transformed and built the community football field. It is unclear what the specified Chinese company is or how much the stadium cost to build.
combined_text:
# Sector
OTHER SOCIAL INFRASTRUCTURE AND SERVICES

# Title
Chinese Embassy funds construction of community football court to Ethiopia

# Description
On April 8, 2016, the Chinese Embassy in Ethiopia officially held the opening ceremony of the community football court in the fourth street of the Kefa District of Addis Ababa. According to the Chinese Embassy in Ethiopia, the embassy and a Chinese company transformed and built the community football field. It is unclear what the specified Chinese company is or how much the stadium cost to build.
justification: Project focuses on community development through sports infrastructure without clear environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Construction of community football court, categorized under social infrastructure and services

title: ZTE donates $10,000 USD to Abebech Gobena Children's Center in Ethiopia
description: In 2016, ZTE Corporation donated $10,000 USD to Abebech Gobena Children's Center, an NGO in Ethiopia. This was done in addition to a number of other pledged projects, seen in #60675, #60676, #60682, #60725, #60726, and #60727.
